Key Match Events: The Dallas Mavericks were shorthanded and finished their four-game road trip 1-3.
The Mavericks took a 110-99 loss to the Houston Rockets.
Quentin Grimes led the Mavericks with 17 points on 6-of-13 shooting.
Kyrie Irving and Klay Thompson each added 16 points for the Mavericks.
The Mavericks turned the ball over 20 times during the game.
The Rockets forced Dallas into plenty of turnovers and fouls.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd attributed the loss to turnovers and fouls.
Kidd mentioned the team's inability to play a clean game as a key factor in the loss.
